candidate_requirement.job_info:
Job Title: Basic Chemicals Operator

Location: Mumbai

Company: BASF

Job Type: Full-time/Part-time/Contract

Job Summary:
We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Basic Chemicals Operator to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for the production, quality control, and safety management of basic chemical products. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of chemical processes and a commitment to maintaining a safe and efficient working environment.

Key Responsibilities:
Operate and monitor chemical production equipment and processes according to standard operating procedures (SOPs).
Conduct regular inspections and quality checks of raw materials and finished products to ensure compliance with industry standards.
Maintain accurate production logs and documentation, including batch records and equipment maintenance.
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving production issues, collaborating with engineering and maintenance teams as needed.
Adhere to safety protocols and environmental regulations to ensure a safe working environment.
Participate in training programs to enhance knowledge of chemical processes and safety practices.
Maintain a clean and organized work area, following 5S principles.
Qualifications:
High school diploma or equivalent; associate degree or certification in chemical technology or a related field preferred.
Previous experience in a chemical manufacturing environment is a plus.
Strong understanding of chemical safety and handling procedures.
Ability to operate machinery and use various hand tools.
Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Good communication and teamwork abilities.
Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends and overtime as needed.
Benefits:
Competitive salary
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Retirement savings plan
Opportunities for professional development and advancement

company.name: BASF
company.job_address: 314, 315, 316, Ghanshyam Enclave, Near Lalji Pada Police Chowky, New Link Road, Kandivali (West)

candidate_requirement.job_info:
Job Title: Agrochemicals

Location: Chandigarh


Company: Ran Chemicals Pvt. Ltd.

Job Type: Full-time/Part-time/Contract

Job Summary:
We are seeking a knowledgeable and motivated Agrochemicals Sales Specialist to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for promoting and selling our range of agrochemical products, including fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides, to farmers, agricultural cooperatives, and distributors. This role requires a strong understanding of agricultural practices, excellent customer service skills, and the ability to build lasting relationships with clients.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement effective sales strategies to increase market share for agrochemical products.
Identify and target potential customers, including farmers, agronomists, and agricultural retailers.
Provide technical support and product recommendations based on customer needs and crop requirements.
Conduct product demonstrations and training sessions to educate customers about the proper use and benefits of agrochemicals.
Monitor and report on market trends, customer feedback, and competitor activities to inform sales strategies.
Collaborate with the marketing team to develop promotional materials and campaigns.
Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and inventory management in the CRM system.
Attend agricultural trade shows, conferences, and industry events to promote products and network with potential clients.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Agriculture, Agronomy, Horticulture, or a related field.
Proven experience in sales or business development within the agrochemical or agricultural industry.
Strong knowledge of agricultural practices, crop management, and agrochemical products.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a results-driven mindset.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.
Willingness to travel frequently to meet with clients and attend events.
Benefits:
Competitive salary with commission-based incentives
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance
Retirement savings plan with company matching
Opportunities for professional development and training
Flexible work environment and schedule

company.name: Ran Chemicals Pvt. Ltd.
company.job_address:
314, 315, 316, Ghanshyam Enclave, Near Lalji Pada Police Chowky, New Link Road, Chandigarh
 (West)

candidate_requirement.job_info:
Job Title: Polymer Engineer

Location: Mumbai

Company: BAFC

Job Type: Full-time/Part-time/Contract

Job Summary:
We are seeking a skilled Polymer Engineer to join our research and development team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing, testing, and optimizing polymer materials for various applications. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in polymer chemistry and engineering, with experience in material analysis and product development.

Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and test new polymer formulations for use in industries such as automotive, packaging, construction, and healthcare.
Conduct research to improve the performance, durability, and sustainability of polymer products.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product design, manufacturing, and quality assurance, to ensure polymer materials meet the necessary specifications and standards.
Perform material characterization tests, including thermal, mechanical, and chemical analysis.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to polymer processing and manufacturing.
Stay up-to-date with advancements in polymer technology, sustainability practices, and industry trends.
Prepare technical reports and documentation for internal and external stakeholders.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Polymer Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in polymer formulation, processing, and testing.
Strong knowledge of polymer properties, material behavior, and manufacturing processes such as extrusion, injection molding, and compounding.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in laboratory testing equipment and data analysis software.
Good communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Benefits:
Competitive salary with opportunities for performance bonuses
Health, dental, and vision insurance
401(k) retirement plan with company matching
Opportunities for career advancement and professional development
Flexible working hours and work-from-home options

candidate_requirement.job_info:
Job Title: Water Treatment Chemicals Specialist

Location: Chandigarh

Company: Ran Chemicals Pvt. Ltd.

Job Type: Full-time/Part-time/Contract

Job Summary:
We are looking for an experienced and knowledgeable Water Treatment Chemicals Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for the selection, application, and optimization of chemical treatments for water systems in industrial, municipal, and commercial settings. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in chemistry, water treatment processes, and customer service.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement water treatment programs for customers using the appropriate chemicals to address issues such as scaling, corrosion, microbial growth, and fouling.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for water treatment processes, analyzing system performance and chemical effectiveness.
Conduct site visits to monitor the application of water treatment chemicals and ensure that proper dosing and procedures are followed.
Perform water quality analysis, interpret lab results, and recommend corrective actions to improve water system performance.
Collaborate with clients to identify water treatment goals and provide customized solutions for cooling towers, boilers, and wastewater treatment systems.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry regulations, standards, and best practices for chemical use in water treatment.
Prepare reports on treatment efficacy, chemical usage, and system performance for clients.
Work with sales teams to identify opportunities for business growth by promoting water treatment chemical products and services.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Environmental Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in water treatment chemical applications, preferably in an industrial or commercial setting.
Strong knowledge of water chemistry and treatment processes, including coagulation, disinfection, and pH adjustment.
Familiarity with relevant regulations such as EPA standards and water quality guidelines.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate technical information effectively to clients and colleagues.
Proficient in Microsoft Office and data analysis tools.
Willingness to travel to client sites for monitoring and support.
Benefits:
Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses
Health, dental, and vision insurance
401(k) retirement savings plan with company matching
Paid time off and holiday leave
Professional development and training opportunities

company.name: Ran Chemicals Pvt. Ltd.

candidate_requirement.job_info:
A Shopify extension refers to an add-on or plugin that enhances the functionality of a Shopify store. These extensions are typically used to extend Shopify's core capabilities, allowing merchants to integrate additional features or services without having to build them from scratch. Shopify extensions are available in the Shopify App Store and cover a wide range of purposes, including:

Marketing and SEO: Extensions that help improve search engine rankings, social media marketing, or advertising.
Payment gateways: Adding support for different payment methods beyond the default options.
Shipping and fulfillment: Tools to simplify shipping, track deliveries, or manage returns.
Inventory management: To manage stock levels, automate reordering, or sync with external inventory systems.
Customer support: Chat widgets, email support tools, and CRM integrations to enhance customer service.
Analytics and reporting: More detailed data tracking and performance analytics.

We are seeking a knowledgeable and dedicated Agrochemicals Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing, promoting, and managing agrochemical products that enhance agricultural productivity and sustainability. This role involves collaborating with farmers, agronomists, and research teams to ensure effective use of agrochemicals while adhering to safety and environmental regulations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research on agrochemical formulations and their effectiveness on various crops.
  • Develop and implement product marketing strategies to promote agrochemical products.
  • Provide technical support and advice to farmers and agronomists regarding product application and usage.
  • Monitor and analyze market trends and competitor products to identify opportunities for growth.
  • Collaborate with regulatory agencies to ensure compliance with agrochemical regulations and safety standards.
  • Organize and conduct training sessions and workshops for agricultural stakeholders on best practices for agrochemical use.
  • Prepare and present reports on product performance, market analysis, and research findings.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Agronomy, Horticulture, Agricultural Science, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
  • Proven experience in the agrochemical industry, including product development, sales, or technical support.
  • Strong understanding of agronomic practices and crop protection methods.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective stakeholder engagement.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
  • Familiarity with regulatory compliance and safety standards in agrochemicals.

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
  • Health, dental, and retirement benefits.
  • Opportunities for professional development and continuous learning.
  • A dynamic and collaborative work environment.

We are seeking a talented and innovative Polymer Scientist to join our team at [Company Name]. In this role, you will be responsible for researching, developing, and testing polymer materials for various applications. You will work closely with engineers and product development teams to ensure the successful implementation of polymer solutions in our products.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research on new polymer materials and their properties to meet specific application requirements.
  • Develop and optimize polymer synthesis and processing methods.
  • Perform characterization of polymers using techniques such as rheology, spectroscopy, and chromatography.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate polymer materials into product designs.
  • Analyze and interpret experimental data to support product development and optimization.
  • Prepare technical documentation, including reports, presentations, and patent applications.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, advancements in polymer science, and emerging technologies.
  • Ensure compliance with safety regulations and best practices in laboratory work.
  •  

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Polymer Science, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, or a related field; Master’s or Ph.D. is preferred.
  • years of experience in polymer research and development or a related field.
  • Strong knowledge of polymer chemistry, physics, and processing techniques.
  • Experience with polymer characterization and testing methods.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work in a team environment.
  •  

Preferred Skills:

  • Familiarity with computational modeling of polymer behavior.
  • Experience with processing techniques such as extrusion, molding, and 3D printing.
  • Knowledge of regulatory standards related to polymer applications.
  •  

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
  • Comprehensive health, dental, and retirement benefits.
  • Opportunities for professional development and continuing education.
  • A collaborative and innovative work environment.

Job Title: Adhesives and Sealants Specialist

Location: Mumbai

Job Type: Part-Time 

Job Overview

We are seeking a skilled Adhesives and Sealants Specialist to join our team. This role involves working with various adhesive and sealant materials to support the development, testing, and application processes. The ideal candidate will have strong technical knowledge of adhesives and sealants, experience in material science, and a practical approach to solving application challenges in diverse industries such as automotive, construction, electronics, and manufacturing.

Key Responsibilities

  • Technical Support: Provide expert guidance on selecting and applying adhesives and sealants for specific project requirements.
  • Product Development: Collaborate with R&D to formulate new adhesive and sealant products, conducting trials and optimizing formulations to meet performance standards.
  • Testing & Quality Assurance: Conduct tests to evaluate the strength, durability, and environmental resistance of adhesives and sealants, ensuring products meet industry and regulatory standards.
  • Customer Consultation: Work with clients to understand their needs, recommend appropriate solutions, and support them through the application process.
  • Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve any issues related to adhesion, compatibility, and longevity of sealant applications in various environments.
  • Documentation & Compliance: Maintain accurate documentation for formulations, test results, and ensure compliance with safety and environmental regulations.
  •  

Qualifications

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Material Science, Chemical Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience: 3+ years of experience in adhesives, sealants, or related industry, with a proven track record in product development or technical support.
  • Technical Skills: Familiarity with adhesive application techniques, testing equipment, and quality standards.
  • Communication Skills: Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with R&D, production, and customer service teams.
  • Problem-Solving Skills: Excellent analytical abilities to troubleshoot and optimize adhesive applications.
  •  

Preferred Skills

  • Knowledge of industry standards (e.g., ASTM, ISO) for adhesives and sealants.
  • Familiarity with common testing methodologies for adhesion, durability, and environmental resistance.
  • Experience with automated dispensing systems or robotic application of adhesives is a plus.

Job Description:

We are looking for an experienced and detail-oriented Fine Chemicals Production Manager to join our team at [Company Name]. In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing the production of fine chemicals, ensuring that all processes are efficient, safe, and compliant with regulatory standards. You will lead a team of chemists and production staff to meet production goals while maintaining high-quality standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage and oversee the daily operations of the fine chemicals production facility.
  • Develop and implement production plans, schedules, and processes to meet production targets and timelines.
  • Ensure compliance with safety, quality, and environmental regulations throughout the production process.
  • Optimize production processes to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and minimize waste.
  • Collaborate with R&D teams to scale up new fine chemical products from the laboratory to commercial production.
  • Conduct regular inspections and audits of production processes and facilities to ensure adherence to quality standards.
  • Train and mentor production staff to promote a culture of safety and continuous improvement.
  • Prepare reports on production metrics, including yield, efficiency, and quality control.
  •  

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or a related field; Master’s degree is preferred.
  • years of experience in fine chemicals production or a related field.
  • Strong knowledge of chemical production processes, equipment, and safety protocols.
  • Excellent leadership, organizational, and communication skills.
  • Ability to analyze data and make informed decisions to optimize production.
  •  

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with batch processing and continuous production techniques.
  • Familiarity with regulatory compliance (e.g., FDA, EPA, REACH).
  • Proficiency in data analysis and production management software.
  •  

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
  • Comprehensive health, dental, and retirement benefits.
  • Opportunities for professional development and continuing education.
  • A collaborative and innovative work environment.

Job Title: Agrochemical Sales Manager

Location: Pune
Reports To: Khushi 

Job Summary

We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Agrochemical Sales Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in the agrochemical sector, with strong sales, customer relationship, and market development skills. This position is crucial to the growth and success of our agrochemical product line in the agricultural industry.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute the sales strategy for agrochemical products across various regions.
  • Identify new business opportunities and build strong relationships with distributors, retailers, and large agricultural farms.
  • Educate potential and existing clients about our products and how they can benefit their operations.
  • Provide technical support and product knowledge to clients.
  • Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer feedback to refine sales strategies.
  • Collaborate with product development and marketing teams to ensure market needs are being met with appropriate solutions.
  • Negotiate contracts and pricing terms, ensuring profitability while maintaining customer satisfaction.
  • Prepare sales reports and forecasts to track progress and inform management.
  • Attend trade shows, conferences, and industry events to network and promote company products.
  • Ensure compliance with regulatory standards in agrochemical product sales and distribution.
  •  

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Agricultural Science, Agronomy, Chemistry, or a related field.
  • Minimum of [X] years of experience in agrochemical sales or a related field.
  • Strong knowledge of agrochemical products, their application, and regulatory requirements.
  • Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
  • Proven ability to meet or exceed sales targets.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Willingness to travel frequently to meet clients and prospects.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  •  

Preferred Skills/Experience:

  • Master’s degree in a related field.
  • Prior experience working with agricultural stakeholders (e.g., farmers, distributors, agricultural advisors).
  • Familiarity with the latest trends and technologies in the agrochemical industry.
  •  

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and commission structure.
  • Health and wellness benefits.
  • Professional development opportunities.
  • Flexible working arrangements (if applicable).

candidate_requirement.job_info:
We are looking for a dedicated and knowledgeable Water Treatment Chemicals Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing, recommending, and implementing chemical solutions for water treatment processes. This role requires an understanding of water treatment principles, the ability to analyze water quality, and the expertise to select and apply chemicals that ensure clean, safe, and effective water treatment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop, implement, and monitor water treatment programs for various industries including industrial, municipal, and commercial sectors.
  • Analyze water quality and identify chemical treatments based on specific needs, such as scale prevention, corrosion control, and disinfection.
  • Ensure that chemical dosing systems are operating efficiently and effectively.
  • Maintain inventory of water treatment chemicals and coordinate with suppliers for timely deliveries.
  • Conduct regular inspections and assessments of water treatment systems.
  • Provide technical support and training to clients or field technicians.
  • Collaborate with the R&D team to develop new chemical products or improve existing formulations.
  • Ensure compliance with environmental and safety regulations regarding chemical handling and disposal.
  • Prepare detailed reports on water quality analysis, chemical use, and treatment outcomes.
  • Offer troubleshooting and problem-solving support for customers experiencing issues with their water treatment systems.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Environmental Engineering, Water Resources Management, or related field.
  • Proven experience in water treatment, chemical handling, or a similar field.
  • Strong knowledge of water chemistry and treatment technologies.
  • Ability to understand complex technical data and communicate it effectively.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Experience with water treatment chemical testing and analysis tools.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Preferred Skills:

  • Certification in water treatment or chemical handling (e.g., AWWA, OSHA).
  • Previous experience in the water treatment chemical industry.

Job Title: Specialty Chemicals Specialist

Job Location: [Location]
Reports To: [Department/Manager]

Job Overview:

We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Specialty Chemicals Specialist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of specialty chemicals and their applications across various industries, including manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, food and beverage, and consumer goods. This position involves identifying, developing, and implementing innovative chemical solutions that meet customer needs while ensuring the highest standards of quality, safety, and environmental compliance.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Research, develop, and implement specialty chemical products and solutions tailored to specific customer applications.
  • Collaborate with R&D and product development teams to create new chemical formulations and enhance existing products.
  • Provide technical expertise to clients and internal teams regarding the application, benefits, and safety of specialty chemicals.
  • Manage product trials, evaluations, and product testing, ensuring all chemical formulations meet regulatory and industry standards.
  • Monitor market trends and customer needs to identify new opportunities for specialty chemicals.
  • Assist in product launches and marketing efforts, including technical presentations, demonstrations, and training sessions for clients.
  • Ensure that all specialty chemical products comply with safety regulations and environmental laws.
  • Prepare detailed reports and technical documentation, including specifications, safety data sheets (SDS), and product manuals.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers, manufacturers, and customers.
  • Offer troubleshooting support for customers to resolve issues related to chemical applications.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proven experience in specialty chemicals, product development, or chemical manufacturing.
  • In-depth knowledge of specialty chemical applications in various industries.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Ability to communicate complex technical information clearly to non-technical audiences.
  • Excellent project management, organizational, and time management skills.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills for customer-facing roles.
  • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience in regulatory compliance (e.g., REACH, OSHA, EPA).
  • Certification in specialty chemical handling or management.
  • Previous experience working in industries such as pharmaceuticals, coatings, food processing, or personal care.

We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Clinical Trials Associate to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting clinical trials by coordinating daily activities, ensuring regulatory compliance, managing data, and facilitating communication among stakeholders. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to groundbreaking clinical research that directly impacts patient care and medical advancements.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Trial Coordination: Assist in planning, organizing, and coordinating various phases of clinical trials.
  • Regulatory Compliance: Ensure compliance with all regulatory and ethical guidelines, including FDA, GCP, and IRB standards.
  • Data Management: Collect, input, and maintain accurate clinical data. Verify data accuracy, manage discrepancies, and generate data reports.
  • Documentation: Prepare, organize, and maintain essential clinical documents such as trial protocols, patient consent forms, and case report forms (CRFs).
  • Participant Engagement: Recruit, screen, and coordinate communication with trial participants; monitor participant compliance and manage follow-up visits.
  • Communication: Liaise with trial sponsors, clinical investigators, site staff, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth communication and trial progress.
  • Monitoring and Reporting: Assist in monitoring clinical sites for protocol adherence, data quality, and trial progression; generate and analyze trial reports.
  • Inventory Management: Oversee study supplies, manage inventory, and ensure necessary materials are available for trial activities.
  • Issue Resolution: Identify potential challenges within trials and proactively work to resolve them with minimal impact on study timelines.
  • Trial Closeout: Assist in closeout procedures, ensuring all data is complete and final reports are submitted.

Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Life Sciences, Healthcare, or related field.
  • Experience: 1-2 years of experience in clinical research or a related field preferred.
  • Knowledge: Familiarity with clinical research regulations (GCP, FDA, ICH guidelines), experience in data entry and management, and understanding of clinical trial phases.
  • Skills: Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, effective communication abilities, and strong problem-solving skills.
  • Technical Skills: Proficient in MS Office Suite and clinical trial management software (CTMS). Familiarity with Electronic Data Capture (EDC) systems is a plus.
  • Certifications: Clinical Research Coordinator (CRC) or Clinical Research Associate (CRA) certification is advantageous but not required.

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Special Chemicals Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in chemical research, product development, and technical support for special chemical products. You will play a key role in developing, optimizing, and implementing chemical solutions tailored to various industries.
 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Research and Development:
    • Conduct experiments to formulate and test special chemical products.
    • Analyze product performance and recommend improvements.
  • Product Management:
    • Oversee the production processes to ensure consistency and quality.
    • Develop technical documentation and safety data sheets (SDS).
  • Technical Support:
    • Collaborate with clients to provide technical solutions for their specific chemical needs.
    • Address product-related issues and offer troubleshooting support.
  • Market Analysis:
    • Identify market trends and opportunities in the special chemicals sector.
    • Assist the sales team in understanding technical aspects of products.
  • Compliance:
    • Ensure adherence to industry standards and regulatory guidelines for chemical production and usage.
    • Maintain environmental and safety protocols during chemical handling.

We are seeking an experienced and knowledgeable Agrochemicals Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing technical expertise in the field of agrochemicals, focusing on product development, pest control solutions, and improving crop yields. The Agrochemicals Specialist will play a critical role in ensuring the safe and efficient use of chemical products in agricultural practices.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Product Development: Collaborate with R&D teams to develop and improve agrochemical products, ensuring they meet agricultural and environmental safety standards.
  • Technical Support: Provide expert advice to farmers and agronomists on the appropriate use of agrochemicals, including application rates, timing, and safety precautions.
  • Market Research: Conduct research to identify emerging trends in agrochemicals and provide market insights for new product development.
  • Regulatory Compliance: Ensure that all products and practices comply with local, state, and federal regulations regarding agrochemicals.
  • Training and Education: Deliver training sessions for farmers, distributors, and colleagues on the safe and effective use of agrochemicals.
  • Sustainability Initiatives: Promote the adoption of environmentally sustainable practices in the use of agrochemicals to reduce the impact on ecosystems.
  • Customer Relationship Management: Maintain and build relationships with key customers, stakeholders, and industry experts to improve customer satisfaction and support business growth.
  • Troubleshooting: Investigate and resolve any issues related to the performance of agrochemical products in the field.

We are seeking a skilled and experienced professional to join our team as a Coatings and Paints Specialist. In this role, you will play a vital part in developing, testing, and enhancing coating and paint formulations to meet industry standards and customer requirements. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in chemistry, material science, or a related field, with a deep understanding of coatings and paint technologies.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conduct research on raw materials and their impact on product performance.

  • Collaborate with production teams to scale up formulations from lab to manufacturing.
  • Identify and troubleshoot product defects or inconsistencies.
  • Provide technical support to customers and resolve application-related issues.
  • Stay updated with emerging trends, technologies, and regulations in the coatings and paints industry.

We are seeking a knowledgeable and experienced professional to oversee the development, production, and application of lubricants and greases. The ideal candidate will focus on formulating, testing, and optimizing high-quality lubricants and greases for various industrial, automotive, or specialized applications.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Research and develop formulations for lubricants and greases to meet performance, environmental, and regulatory requirements.
  • Conduct testing and analysis to ensure product quality, durability, and compatibility with machinery.
  • Collaborate with clients to provide tailored lubrication solutions for specific applications.
  • Manage production processes, ensuring adherence to quality standards and safety protocols.
  • Stay updated with industry trends, new technologies, and emerging regulations affecting the lubricant industry.
  • Prepare technical documentation, including safety data sheets, product specifications, and performance reports.
  • Provide training and support to sales and technical teams on lubricant and grease applications.
  • Investigate and resolve customer complaints or product performance issues.

We are looking for a Technician to join our Chemicals Technology Group, supporting research, development, and production activities. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in laboratory and industrial settings, with strong technical skills to assist in the formulation, testing, and quality control of chemical products.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Laboratory Operations:
    • Prepare chemical formulations and solutions following established procedures.
    • Conduct routine chemical and physical tests, ensuring compliance with standards.
    • Operate and maintain laboratory equipment, including spectrometers, chromatographs, and mixers.
  • Research & Development Support:
    • Assist scientists and engineers in experimental setups and trials.
    • Record and analyze data to evaluate the performance of materials and processes.
    • Contribute to the development of new chemical processes and products.
  • Quality Assurance & Control:
    • Perform quality checks on raw materials, intermediate products, and final outputs.
    • Ensure proper documentation of test results and findings.
    • Adhere to safety protocols and regulatory standards during all laboratory activities.
  • Production Support:
    • Scale up lab processes to pilot or production levels under supervision.
    • Monitor and troubleshoot chemical processing equipment during operations.
  • Safety & Maintenance:
    • Maintain a clean and organized workspace in compliance with safety regulations.
    • Ensure proper handling, storage, and disposal of chemicals and hazardous materials.

Polymer Chemicals refer to a broad category of chemical compounds that are used in the synthesis, modification, and processing of polymers. Polymers are large molecules made up of repeating structural units, widely used in industries such as packaging, automotive, construction, electronics, and healthcare.

These chemicals play a crucial role in enhancing the properties of polymers, such as durability, flexibility, thermal stability, and chemical resistance. They are typically categorized into monomers, catalysts, additives, and processing aids, which contribute to polymer production and customization.

Key Applications of Polymer Chemicals:

  1. Plastics Manufacturing:
    • Used to produce everyday plastic products like containers, films, and bottles.
  2. Rubber Production:
    • Essential for creating synthetic rubbers used in tires, seals, and industrial parts.
  3. Adhesives and Sealants:
    • Provide strength, flexibility, and bonding properties for construction and industrial uses.
  4. Textiles and Fibers:
    • Enable the creation of synthetic fibers like nylon, polyester, and acrylics.
  5. Coatings and Paints:
    • Contribute to the durability and finish of paints and coatings.
  6. Electronics:
    • Polymers are used in the production of insulating materials and flexible circuits.

Job Description:
We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Chemical Process Operator to oversee the production and handling of basic chemicals in our manufacturing facility. The ideal candidate will be responsible for operating and maintaining equipment, ensuring safety compliance, and monitoring chemical processes to achieve production targets.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Operate and monitor chemical manufacturing equipment and processes.
  • Maintain production logs and report any operational issues.
  • Conduct routine inspections of equipment and troubleshoot as necessary.
  • Adhere to safety protocols and environmental regulations during production activities.
  • Test and analyze chemical samples to ensure product quality.
  • Collaborate with the quality control and maintenance teams to improve efficiency.

We are looking for a skilled and detail-oriented Fine Chemicals Production Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in the manufacturing and quality control of high-purity chemicals used in a variety of industries, including pharmaceuticals, biotechnology, and agrochemicals. This role involves ensuring the quality, efficiency, and safety of fine chemical production processes.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Oversee the production of fine chemicals, ensuring adherence to safety, quality, and environmental standards.
  • Manage the day-to-day operations of chemical manufacturing processes, including batch production, mixing, and filtration.
  • Perform quality control tests on raw materials, in-process materials, and finished products.
  • Develop and implement process improvements to optimize efficiency and reduce waste.
  • Work closely with R&D and technical teams to scale up new chemical processes.
  • Maintain accurate records of production, testing, and regulatory compliance.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to production processes, equipment, and product quality.
  • Ensure compliance with all regulatory guidelines and industry standards.

We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly skilled Explosives Chemical Specialist to oversee the development, formulation, and testing of explosive materials. The candidate will work closely with R&D teams, safety officers, and regulatory bodies to ensure the safe and effective handling, manufacturing, and deployment of explosive chemicals. This role requires expertise in chemical engineering, materials science, and explosives safety standards.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop, test, and analyze chemical formulations for explosives, ensuring optimal performance and stability.
  • Conduct research to improve the safety, effectiveness, and environmental impact of explosive materials.
  • Perform chemical testing to evaluate explosive properties such as sensitivity, energy output, and stability.
  • Collaborate with manufacturing teams to oversee the production of explosive chemicals, ensuring quality control and compliance with safety regulations.
  • Implement and adhere to all local and international safety standards for explosive materials handling and storage.
  • Develop standard operating procedures (SOPs) for the preparation, handling, and disposal of hazardous chemicals.
  • Investigate incidents or failures involving explosive materials and implement corrective actions.
  • Maintain accurate documentation, including chemical formulations, safety data sheets (SDS), and test results.
